sentences.english: I hate such shallow false pretences.
sentences.chinese: 我讨厌这种肤浅，虚伪的做作。

sentences.english: The 'what if' device is often facile, rarely convincing.
sentences.chinese: “假如”式分析方法常常是肤浅的，很少有说服力。

sentences.english: Succinct is the wisdom soul, long is the superficial embellishments.
sentences.chinese: 简洁是智慧的灵魂，冗长是肤浅的藻饰。

sentences.english: When seen from this stand-point , thing like righteousness are rather shallow.
sentences.chinese: 当从这一立场，观点，正义的事，只是肤浅的事。

sentences.english: It is just because of the marriage system. In the western countries, life-long marriage is rare.
sentences.chinese: 而西方很少一婚到底的，你能说就都是缘本肤浅？

sentences.english: Looks and other more superficial stuff are examples of such things.
sentences.chinese: 比如说外表或者其他一些比较肤浅的表面化的东西。

sentences.english: The saying that beauty is but skin-deep is but a skin-deep saying.
sentences.chinese: “美不过是肤浅之物”这句话本身就是肤浅的。

sentences.english: The saying that beauty is but skin-deep is but a skin-deep saying.
sentences.chinese: “美不过是肤浅之物”这句话本身就是肤浅的。

sentences.english: Today's American writer seems very superficial.
sentences.chinese: 今天的美国作家似乎非常肤浅。

sentences.english: Shwhichleow men believe in luck. Self-trust is the Number1 secret of success.
sentences.chinese: 肤浅的人相信运气，自信才是完成首要的理由。

sentences.english: The naturalist literary sect always thinks shallowly, which determines its short duration.
sentences.chinese: 思考往往是肤浅的，这决定了它的短暂性。

sentences.english: In the hall the shallow challenger shall be allowed to swallow the swallows.
sentences.chinese: 在大厅俚肤浅的挑战者将被允许吞下燕子。

sentences.english: If you are a shallow bitch, I can be a blunt jerk.
sentences.chinese: 如果妳是肤浅的贱货，那我可能是直率的混蛋。

sentences.english: His understanding of the international situation is still superficial.
sentences.chinese: 他对国际形势的了解还是肤浅的。

sentences.english: I like those people who are well educated and not skin-deep .
sentences.chinese: 我喜欢受过良好教育而且不肤浅的人。

sentences.english: All we're going to do here is really just, once again, scratch the surface.
sentences.chinese: 我们在这里只是，肤浅地解析一下。

definition: to believe oneself infallible (idiom)/to be opinionated
sensationalism/vulgar claptrap to please the crowds/playing to the gallery/demagogy
